oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A direct charge pumping technique for spatial profiling of hot-carrier induced interface and oxide traps in MOSFETs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHAPATRA, S
PARIKH, CD
VASI, J
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
VISWANATHAN, CR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: curve fitting
electron traps
electronic density of states
mosfet
semiconductor device testing
interface states
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new charge pumping (CP) technique is proposed to obtain the spatial profile of interface-state density (Nit) and oxide charges (Not) near the drain junction of hot-carrier stressed MOSFETs. Complete separation of Nit from Not is achieved by using a direct noniterative method. The pre-stress CP edge is corrected for the charges associated with both the generated Nit and Not. A closed form model is developed to predict the stress-induced incremental CP current. The damage distributions are obtained after fitting the model with experimental data.
